content: Hello @WG-async-foundations! It's time for our weekly triage meeting.

We have our usual agenda for this week:

  • Announcements
    - (add items)
  • [eholk] New issue triage
  • Discussion on progress/blockers around sprint bugs
We can go ahead and start with announcements.
I don't have much for this week. We had a sprint planning meeting last week, so we've got a new set of sprint goals.

The blog post I promised to publish on async cancellation is well underway; just finishing up the final edits. If I don't publish it this week (I'll be going on vacation soon), then for sure next week.
an RFC is up for static async fn in traits: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3185
Nice! I meant to read that last week. Maybe this week...
Any other announcements?
If not, we can move on.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Next is new issue triage.
We have no new issues!

So let's move on.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Our last topic is general discussion about progress or blockers on sprint bugs.

I made good progress on drop tracking for generator captures. I've got support for if expressions where a value is dropped in one branch but not the other. This should make the other control flow cases pretty easy to handle.
Nice!
All the test cases except the ones around dynamic drop are passing, so I think the control flow stuff is the last piece to work out.
I've started to work async fns in traits, was trying to find a way to create a an associated type on HIR that's not connected to AST, I think I found my way
it's not working yet, currently debugging, I have the node created but my test it not able to find that associated type
Still, that sounds like good progress!

I have an external proc macro crate I'm cleaning up to publish using one alternative syntax: fn* foo() yields i32. Once I publish, I'll be asking people to play with syn and experiment with other syntaxes. Right now it only works in nightly (uses generators) and only works for sync fns, but by the time I publish should support async as well.
Nice!
Out of curiosity, what does supporting async mean in this case?
being able to write async fn foo() yields i32 and get back a function that gives you back impl AsyncIterator
Ah, cool

Not really part of a sprint (yet) but maybe interesting too: I've been working on a test framework for debugger plugins to be used for testing things associated with the crash dump debugging initiative: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-dbg-ext/tree/main/test-framework/dbt

It's in a minimally usable state now, so I soon want to move on to writing actual plugins and starting a discussion about logical stack traces soon.
Nice!

I was planning on looking at stack traces for async code sometime in the next week or so. We should sync up, @mw. I think what I was planning on looking at is kind of orthogonal, but it'd be good to sync up anyway.
Yes, let's do that, @eholk !
I'll send you a calendar invite
Alright, it sounds like we're kind of winding down. Does anyone else have anything to discuss? Otherwise we can wrap things up.
excited about the stack traces work :-)
I don’t have anything to report at the moment
Alright, I'll go ahead and end the meeting. As always, people are welcome to discuss more in the chat.
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks, everyone!
